vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
Δῐόσ-κοροι
(the Attic dialect form, 2nd c.AD: Phrynichus Atticista 212), Ionic dialect and later Διόσκουροι, οἱ, the sons of Zeus, i. e. the twins of Leda, Castor and Polydeuces, [Refs 6th c.BC+]: -κούρων [Refs 5th c.BC+]; -κόρων [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II constellation named from them the Twins, [Refs 3rd c.BC+]
__III ={παρωτίδες}, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: the twin gods Castor and Pollux, the Dioscuri, "sons of Zeus"
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
the twin gods Castor and Pollux, the Dioscuri, "sons of Zeus"
the Dioscuri, Castor and Pollux, sons of Jupiter by Leda, and patrons of sailors, Acts 28:11*
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
Castor and Pollux(雙子座α和β星), 為宙斯(Jupiter)與莉達(Leda)
所生的巒生之子, 被航海家認為守護之神 (徒 28:11)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
Castor and Pollux(双子座α和β星), 为宙斯(Jupiter)与莉达(Leda)
所生的峦生之子, 被航海家认为守护之神 (徒 28:11)
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: Đi-ốt-cua thần sinh đôi Các tượng thần Các-to và Bô-lút, hai vị thần trong thần thoại xưa của Hy-lạp. Hai thần Anh Em Sinh Ðôi.
